intro: Pedicularis praeruptorum, commonly known as the Chinese lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its vibrant red or orange flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forests or along stream banks. Its unique morphology and ecological role make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
